dialogues.text: Davey hurries down the concourse toward Morris' shop. He stops by the front door, momentarily confused by the sign "Out To Lunch", hanging there. He peers through the glass into the store. It's empty. He tries the handle. The front door swings open. He steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks past the games and models, deeper and deeper int the dimly lit store. It is disturbingly quiet. Then he hears a small girl weeping in the back room and moves int that direction. INT. BACK ROOM - DAY ‘87 He steps inside the room to find Kim seated on Morris' desk, her feet swinging off the floor, her eyes filled wi tears. Davey approaches her slowly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Kim --- Kim looks up at him, sees how disheveled he is, wipes her tears away.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (looking around) Nothing. (afraid to ask) Where's Morris?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I don't know. But look.... She points to the video monitor on the desk. A bullet has punctured the center of the glass, sending a spiderweb of cracks out in concentric circles over the entire screen.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 58 Rev. 8/3/83 57 Davey checks out the Atari console, finds no cartridge in it. He just stares at the bullet hole. Kim fills the silence.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Davey? Do you think they -- ?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No! (scared) No way. Morris is too smart for them. We'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (crying anew) I think he's already dead...!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (fearful anger) Shut up! You don't know that. Kim continues to weep, louder now. Davey is sorry for his outburst, puts his arm around her,

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. He tries to figure out what to do next. He sees a clock o the wall, reading 3:30. He picks up a phone, dials.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: What do we do now? (X)

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (thinking) (X) No use calling my dad. He'd never believe me. (getting decisive) You call your mother. Tell her Rice is going to do something with the tape at five thirty. Make her call the police, even if she doesn’t believe you! We need a grownup.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Okay... (pause) What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: S8-A
dialogues.text: thru

dialogues.speaker: 58-C
dialogues.text: s9

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (taking her arm, walking her out) I'm gonna try to find Rice and stop him.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I dunno yet. They exit the shop, arm in arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the street, Da ey stares up at the tall build seeming unsure of what to do next. Flack materializes nex to him, urges him across the street. traffic) Come on! We dox't have much time. Flack continues across th being hit. Davey starts which squeals its brakes nearly hit the boy before busy street without fear of nd blasts its horn. Two others he makes it across, shaken.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: S8-A
dialogues.text: OMITTED thru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flack and Davey sneak through the garage, checking the names on every parking space.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (to Flack, as they run) He said he had to be someplace at 5:30.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: So he's probably taking his car. (pause) Look!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 59
dialogues.text: Flack points to a pearl white Cadillac. on the wall in front of it, a sign reads MR. RICE - DATA POINT. Davey races to the Cadillac, peers inside.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: No room to hide in there. How ‘bout the trunk? Davey finds the car's front door locked, tries a back doo opens it, quickly crawls to the front, pushes the trunk latch in the glove compartment. The Cadillac trunk pops open about two inches. Davey races around, lifts the trunk hurriedly, is about t hop in, but immediately stops short at what he sees. He ( gasps. Morris's crumpled body is in the trunk, his glasses askew his eyes dull and lifeless, a nice, neat bullet hole drilled in the center of one of his eyeglass lenses.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Davey opens his mouth to scream. Flack leaps to his side, clapping his hand over the boy's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Now what's wrong -- ? He follows Davey's frozen gaze to the body in the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Oh -- tough! (X) He glances at the corner ‘vyhere the sound of Rice's foot steps are drawing irrevocahly closer. He goes to lift Dav into the trunk. Davey, terrified, tries to struggle free.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (whispering urgently) ..-Now or never Davey! He lifts Davey into the trunk. Rice rounds a concrete buttress just as his trunk is lowered by Davey. Inside the trunk, Flack, Morris, and Davey are crammed together, Davey holding the trunk closed, about an inch from clicking shut. Rice suspects nothing, gets in his car, starts it up, drives away, tires screeching as he heads up the ramp for the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the bouncing trunk, Davey holds on for dear life. The car suddenly takes a sharp turn and Morris's dead bod rolls over on top of him, pinning him underneath, scaring him to death.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY ., (X)
dialogues.text: (whispering) Jack..! Agent X...? (struggled with corpse) Jack, help me...! Flack materializes inside the crowded trunk, feeling like a pretzel in a sardine can. He helps remove the corpse off Davey.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Isn't it crowded enough in here? (finishing helping) There. You okay? Davey, miserable, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He was my friend. How could they do that to him?

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: He just wasn't good enough.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (outraged) But they didn't have to kill him...!

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: When you've been playing this game as long as I have, you'll get used to this kind of thing. Davey gives Flack a look which indicates he'll never get used to it. There is a long Pause then, motion ceases within the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We've stopped.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Let's see where we are. Davey ever-so-slightly raises the trunk, about an eighth of an inch. He looks out.  61 62 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice pulls up in the Cadillac, parks right behind the van Rice is visibly nervous, keeps checking his watch, paces around. Opbst gets out jof the van, walks over to Haverma as he gets out. They meget near the trunk of the Cadillac Down the street, the Alamo sits waiting, whitewashed and clean in the late afterndon sun. I make the dro Alamo) I never though saying, 'Reme the Russians'd be r the Alamo.’ Heh.

dialogues.speaker: HAVERMAN
dialogues.text: (not getting it) Hunh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey stiffens as he hears this, cracking the lid an eigh of an inch for a look at what's going on. He finds himsel staring at the belt buckles of the two thugs from his sliver of a vantage point.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: (to Haverman) Forget it. You wait here. We got a date with some guy missing two fingers on his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: OPBST
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: I don't Know. They don't want us to know.

dialogues.speaker: OPBST
dialogues.text: They don't tell ya much.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: Just enough. He throws the camera case over his shoulder and starts do the street, followed by Opbst. Haverman turns toward the Caddy and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 64 OMITTED and 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flack turns to Davey with an encouraging wink.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Time to go -- {begins to open the trunk) And remember, you can win or lose the game right here. Good luck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haverman is seated behind|the wheel, reading the paper. Slowly, unseen by him, the trunk lid rises into view through his rear window behind him. Suddenly sensing that something is wrong, he stiffens, his gaze rising to his rearview mirror. The raised trunk lid fills the mirror. He twists in his seat, sthring out the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams out of the car a of the car. He stares in body. id walks rapidly around to the back © the trunk at Morris's crumpled

dialogues.speaker: HAVERMAN
dialogues.text: Shit! He slams the trunk lid sh street, momentarily afrai The street is nearly empt other side. t and turns looking up and down the that a passerby has seen the corpse. except for a few pedestrians on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey stops before the main kntrance to the mission. He spends a moment hiking up hi pants and wiping the sweat off his palms. Then he begins to slowly walk toward the huge double-oak doors. Soe atte A he UCN tht Robe AE rt ae hans Fe 1c flmth Rata  70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey steps through the door and looks around. It isa huge rectangular adobe room, enormous candelabras hang fr the vaulted ceiling. Smaller rooms containing exhibits lead off to one side, security guards posted at both the main entrance and the side door to the gardens. Tourists Pack the place. Davey moves through the throng searching for a glimpse of Opbst and Rice. They're nowhere to be se A small knot of tourists dissolves at the far end of the room and Davey suddenly sees Rice. The killer checks his watch, hikes the camera bag over his shoulder, and begins to move. Davey is directly in his path. If he glances up, he must see the boy. Davey dives behind the first adult h sees, a woman he doesn't even recognize in his panic. Eunice MacCready, the nice lady from the boat, looks down at him curiously, her husband beside her pawing through t postcard rack.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Well, look who's here. Last time (X) I saw you, you were jumping off a boat. Get a little seasick did you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (X)
dialogues.text: Please ma'am, I'm hiding from that man. Davey glances up, recognizes her, but his attention is on Rice. He slides around Eunice, keeping her girth between him and Rice as the killer picks up his stride for the door. She follows the boy's gaze, and sees Rice.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Oh, it's somebody new this time, is it? Are you ready to tell me what this is all about? (to her husband) George! Her husband walks over, mumbling subserviently. In the b.g., a uniformed Guard announces closing time.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, the Alamo will be closing in two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yes, dear.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: {nodding at Davey) Our young friend seems to be in some sort of trouble again ---

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 70
dialogues.text: Rice disappears out the door. Davey takes a step after him, trying to escape the two adults.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Just a second, young man. Eunice grabs him by his shirt collar, dragging him to a sudden halt. Davey twists under her grip, desperate to follow Rice before he loses him.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Davey.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Not Davey Crocket, by any chance...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Ma'am, I really have to go. It's a matter of national security.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: (amused) Well, then. We wouldn't want to stand in your way...! She releases her grip. He scampers away, the nice couple “staring after him. Eunice turns to her husband.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I think the boy needs us.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: I agree. Davey spots Rice through a break in the milling throng ju as the overhead lights begin to flick on and off, a Guard voice echoing in the vaulted room.

dialogues.speaker: _ GUARD
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, the Alamo is closing. Everyone please exit through the front doors <--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Guard begins flashing the lights as people begin to m out. As Davey watches, Rice carefully puts down his camer case and steps forward, Nikon in hand, seemingly framing snapshot of a painting of Davey Crocket. Davey dodges through the crowd, heading for the camera case. Rice turns just as Davey steps out of a knot of tourists, grabs the case, and darts back into the crowd. Rice yells after him.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: Hey! Davey darts across the Alamo, past the rather startled Mr. and Mrs. MacCready, heading for the front door. A security Guard steps out to grab him, but Davey dodges him, slamming through the front door, pursued by both the Guard, the MacCreadys, and Rice. 71 OMITTED thru 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just about to pick up speed and be off when the Guar catches him by the nape of the neck. The Guard tears the camera case out of his hand and shakes him so hard his teeth rattle.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: You've got a hell of a nerve, kid, stealing inside the Alamo. Where's your patriotism or is that word too big for you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (trying to talk between rattling teeth) But, but --- George and Eunice step through the door into the plaza outside the Alamo, George hurrying over.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: He didn't steal anything, officer.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (holding up the camera case) But he took this ---

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 75
dialogues.text: George smiles apologetically and holds up his camera case it's almost identical to the one Davey grabbed.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: A simple mistake. I asked the boy to pick up my camera case and he took the wrong one. Rice slams through the front door behind them and skids t a halt when he sees Davey with the security Guard and the nice couple. Trying to preserve his anonymity, he turns. walk off toward the distant figures of Opbst and Haverman The Guard holds up the camera case he took from Davey and yells at Rice.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey, this your camera case? Rice halts, looking like he'd like to deny it, but thinks better of it, and manages a very uncomfortable nod.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Well, come on over here and take it. George turns to Eunice, throwing a smile at Davey on the way.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Why don't you take the boy to our car while I straighten this out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (desperately pointing to the case in the Guard's arms) But that case has the secret plans in it ---

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: (patting Davey on the head) Of course, it does, dear.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But it does --- Before he can say anything more, Eunice takes him by the shoulders and steers him toward a non-descript blue Ford Fairlane parked just down the street. Davey keeps glancin back at the three men, the security Guard, Rice, and Geor MacCready lost in conversation. And behind them, watching him stands Opbst. Eunice clucks at him the entire time as she leads him toward her car.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Now, now, don't fret yourself. George will take care of everything. He's very good at that. She opens the passenger side door to the front and shoos Davey inside before he can argue any further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey slides across| the seat and stares out the driver's side window as Eunice gets in beside him. He watches as the security Guard walks away, apparently satisfied with whatever explanatidn he's received. George continues to talk to Rice, the glder man gesturing animatedly, seeming very angry, the killer listening almost contritely, both men clutching theiy identical camera cases. Davey's eyes widen as the convezrsation suddenly ceases and the two exchange camera cages.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He's giveh him the camera case back.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: He did? ell, he must have had a reason to do it. George always knows what\he's doing. Davey turns to Eunicel unaware that George has broken fre of Rice behind him and is walking toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But you don't understand. There was a Donkey Kong tape in there, only it wasn't a Donkey Kong game, it was --- The driver's door suddenly opens and George slides in, tossing the camera case \to Davey, and starting the car.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Is this what yqu're so worried about?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (holding) the case almost broken-héartedly) No, sir, it was |\the other case, the one you gave that man just now. That was the one that had the secret plans in it. |

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ford pulls out into/ traffic and disappears down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they drive along, dusk begins to slip into night. George takes his eyes from the road long enough to toss a amused glance at the dispirited boy in the seat beside hi

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure I gave the wrong case back?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (nedding at the case in Davey's hands) Open it and find out. Davey opens the case, hardly daring to believe the tape might actually be there. But there it is at the bottom of the case, black and rectangular with that stupid logo on it. Davey whips the tape out, flashing George a joyous smile.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You got it!

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: (smiling benevolently at him) See. I told you. George is real good at making things come out right.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (to George) But how'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I just gave that man my camera case in its place. He never noticed the difference. Now do you mind telling us what this is all about? After all I've sacrificed my good camera to save your Donkey Kong tape.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But it isn't a Donkey Kong tape. There's an extra micro chip in here that contains the plans to some important American defense project.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Then why would that man have it at the Alamo?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He was going to give it to some Russian spy.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: (breaking in) Really? Did he say what this spy looked like?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Only that he had two fingers missing.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: How exciting! May I see that tape, Davey?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Sure. He holds the tape out to her. She primly removes one of the gloves she always wears and grasps the tape with her thumb, first and second fingers. The other two are missing. Davey stares at the mutilated hand in numb horror. Eunice frowns at the boy.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Something wrong, Davey? His terror-filled eyes lift to stare at her cold face. He makes a sudden dive over her for the door, but George grabs him and roughly yanks him back down in the seat, hurting him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Sorry.... Eunice takes out a bottle of Chanel Number 5 and methodic sprinkles the "perfume" onto her handkerchief as Davey wa fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Such a clever little boy, George. I wish we could bring him with us to Mexico City.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I've made arrangements with Rice. He'll take care of him for us on our way to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: (upset) I don't like his methods, and I don't like those two thugs of his.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I made it very clear to him back -there how displeased we are with this whole mess. He won't dare make another mistake.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Not if he wants to keep doing business with us.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I made that clear. What time is our flight?

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: (still adding perfume) Midnight. We'll go back and check out now, but I think we should cancel our dinner reservations. What a nuisance! Suddenly and without warning Eunice clamps the handkerchi over Davey's face. He struggles against the chloroform as everything goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny pinholes of light leak through portions of the Cadil chassis and fall on Davey's unconscious face. Flack's voice comes out of the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Wake up. Somebody's coming. Davey opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: . (groggily) Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Right back where you put us. Davey spots Morris's body next to his own, is sickened at the reminder of his friend's death. Footsteps approach.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Play dead or we will be. Davey shuts his eyes, feigns unconsciousness. Someone tries to open the trunk, but it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: OPBST'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (just outside trunk) Hey...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opbst is standing at the closed Caddy trunk. Haverman sit in the driver's seat, reading a football magazine. Eviden but not prominent, is the fact that the keys are in the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: OPBST
dialogues.text: (continuing) ---Pop the trunk, will ya? Haverman pushes the button in the Cadillac glove compartm and the trunk pops open about two inches. Opbst opens it and peers into it.

dialogues.speaker: OPBST
dialogues.text: The kid's still out cold.

dialogues.speaker: HAVERMAN
dialogues.text: Want to kill him now?

dialogues.speaker: OPBST
dialogues.text: Wait'll we get to the desert.

dialogues.speaker: HAVERMAN
dialogues.text: What's taking him so long?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 80
dialogues.text: HAVERMAN (Cont'd) {getting out of car) Can't take him two hours to divide up the money...I think we should get extra for killin' the kid. That wasn't part of the original deal.

dialogues.speaker: OPBST
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's go hurry him up. Opbst slams the trunk closed, walks to the stair door wit Haverman.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TRUNK 82
dialogues.text: Davey tries to pry open the trunk. It is locked firmly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We'll never get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Stay cool. (pause) I'm thinking. (pause) Call Kim. Get her out to the airport. Maybe she can bust the MacCready's Without you. Davey fumbles for his walkie-talkie, finds it in his back back, whispers into it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Kim, Kim --- Just static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Ace...! More static.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Why can't I get her?

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Maybe her radio's busted.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Well, think of something!

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: See that crowbar? Davey grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The empty backseat is suddenly disturbed by a moving lump in the plush upholstery. A moment later, Davey breaks through, crowbar in hand. Flack peers through the hole from the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Let's get outa here. Open the door. Davey spies Rice's car phone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Wait. Davey clambers across the seat and into the front. He picks up the phone and begins to dial. cut To

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY AND FLACK IN CAR
dialogues.text: Kim sits in the dark, biting her nails as she waits for h mother to come home. The phone rings on the table beside her. She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Kim, it's me. Did you tell your mother?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (upset) No. She hasn't come home yet. I don't know where she is. She had to cater somewhere, but I can't read her writing. It's ineligible.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Kim, you gotta get to the airport. Right now!

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Davey, it's past my bedtime!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: The spies have the tape. They're old. A man and a lady. She only has three fingers.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I'm in a car. Listen: They're gonna fly to Mexico City. At midnight.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (practically in tears) How am I supposed to get to the airport?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Use your bus pass....

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Duck!

dialogues.speaker: AND VILLAINS
dialogues.text: Davey sees Rice, Haverman, and Opbst returning toward the trunk. The thugs are pocketing their share of the money. Davey hangs up on Kim, ducks below the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: OPBST
dialogues.text: What about the girl? You want us to get her, too?

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: I've already taken care of that. Puzzled looks from Opbst and Haverman. Rice pulls a triggering device out of his pocket. It is an everyday household item.

dialogues.speaker: OPBST
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: HAVERMAN
dialogues.text: Model airplane control.

dialogues.speaker: OPBST
dialogues.text: What're ya gonna do? Dive bomb her? Heh heh. Haverman chuckles along with his pal. Rice doesn't laugh. Instead, with a certain amount of pride, he pushes a litt button, bringing a ba tery power indicator into the green activated part of a scale.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 85
dialogues.text: Davey, hiding in the car, can't tell what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: (patronizingly) Not quite. Actually, it's a trigger -..for a clock...which sets off enough plastique to blow up half her neigh- borhood. Davey is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: HAVERMAN
dialogues.text: Ya mighta told us. Hell, we coulda been blown up with her.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: (gestures with trigger) That's why I used the timer. I push this...and...our little friend will have a very short, very loud night- mare in... {checks watch;
...@xactly one hour. Rice pushes the button. Davey looks at the clock on the dashboard: 11:00 PM.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: That'll be midnight...!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: ~ (horrified) I gotta call Kim!

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (referring to the action at the car's rear) Not now, you don't.... 86 OMITTED and 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opbst opens the trunk, the rising trunk blocking Davey's view through the rear window.

dialogues.speaker: OPBST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He's gone! The trunk lid slams down, revealing all three killers. Opbst pulls a pistol from his belt. Rice and Haverman do the same.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: (looking around) He won't get far. Inside the car, Davey's eyes widen with fear. Behind him, seen through the car windows, the three killers start to spread out in their search. Davey locks the front doors and reaches for the ignition key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three killers suddenly freeze as the Caddy engine lea to life. Rice raises his pistol, stares at the car.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: What the <-- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey, who isn't quite tall enough to both hit the accel- erator and see out the windshield at the same time, turns to Flack for help.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You gotta tell me how to drive this thing!

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (clearly bluffing) Uh, well...this here's the, uh... shift?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: This is the shift.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Well, hell! What d'ya want from me? This is a real car! I'm only a figment of your imagination! Davey slips the automatic transmission into reverse, glan out the side window, sees all three killers dashing towar the car. He slips down to the gas pedal.  92 93 95

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddy engine whines, and the car suddenly leaps back- ward, headed right toward the three killers.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: Look out! All three dive for cover as the Caddy, apparently driver- less, roars at them and hits a post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey selects drive.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (to Flack) Sorry. As the car suddenly shoots forward, Flack is knocked back over the seat by the tremendous acceleration.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: I'm okay, just keep drivin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three killers leap to their feet and run after the ca as it caroms off another post then off the the walls and the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is going like a fitful bat out of hell, scraping along the walls at one point, stripping away paint and tearing off chrome, clipping a corner at another point, demolishing a headlight, going in fits and starts up the ramps and through the various levels of the garage as Dav either peers over the steering wheel, out the window or slips beneath the wheel to give it more gas. Flack sits behind him, enjoying the ride.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Not bad for your first lesson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddy is nowhere in sight. Rice comes to a stop besid a shorn-off Cadillac mirror, picks it up, looks around th garage.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 96 0 st

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 35
dialogues.text: From the level above, the sound of a terrible collision echoes down.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: That little bastard. (back to Haverman as he and Opbst catch up) Quick, get the van and follow us. Haverman turns back, as Rice and Opbst rush toward the ne ramp up, on foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac has come to a forced halt against a wall. Inside the car, Davey finds reverse, and the car burns rubber, backing up a dozen yards, then skids to a halt as Davey slams on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flack sits in the backseat of the stopped car, more than Just visibly shaken by the crush. Davey is trying the pho again.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I gotta warn Kim...!

dialogues.speaker: . FLACK
dialogues.text: (seeing Opbst and Rice over his shoulder) Better wait. Davey sees what he's talking about, drops the phone, floo it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car screeches away, leaving Rice and Opbst behind, firing at the car with their Pistols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car barrels out of the exit, flies five feet in the a before it slams back to earth, and takes a left turn into street on two wheels.  99-4 100 101 102 #02160 gl (X) Rev. 8/3/83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac turns right into another street and proceedi along the wrong side of the street, approaches a street sweeper truck with a flashing yellow light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flack is braced in his seat, held there by fear, staring out the window at the approaching sweeper.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (stiffening in his seat even more) Daveyyyyy...! Davey whirls the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car averts the sweeper but mounts the opposite curb a skids into the side of a building, bringing building debr crashing down on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the dust settles, Flack picks himself up off the floor boards with a groan while Davey fumbles with the car phon trying to dial out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I gotta call Kim and tell her about the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: She's probably already on her way to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Then she's prob'ly safe.

dialogues.speaker: LACK
dialogues.text: (thinking) Uniess she's carrying the damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: She couldn't be... {tries his radio) Hello, Kim...? {getting no answer) Why won't she answer?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Guard begins flashing the lights as people begin to m out. As Davey watches, Rice carefully puts down his camer case and steps forward, Nikon in hand, seemingly framing snapshot of a painting of Davey Crocket. Davey dodges through the crowd, heading for the camera case. Rice turns just as Davey steps out of a knot of tourists, grabs the case, and darts back into the crowd. Rice yells after him.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: Hey! Davey darts across the Alamo, past the rather startled Mr. and Mrs. MacCready, heading for the front door. A security Guard steps out to grab him, but Davey dodges him, slamming through the front door, pursued by both the Guard, the MacCreadys, and Rice. 71 OMITTED thru 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just about to pick up speed and be off when the Guar catches him by the nape of the neck. The Guard tears the camera case out of his hand and shakes him so hard his teeth rattle.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: You've got a hell of a nerve, kid, stealing inside the Alamo. Where's your patriotism or is that word too big for you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (trying to talk between rattling teeth) But, but --- George and Eunice step through the door into the plaza outside the Alamo, George hurrying over.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: He didn't steal anything, officer.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (holding up the camera case) But he took this ---

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 75
dialogues.text: George smiles apologetically and holds up his camera case it's almost identical to the one Davey grabbed.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: A simple mistake. I asked the boy to pick up my camera case and he took the wrong one. Rice slams through the front door behind them and skids t a halt when he sees Davey with the security Guard and the nice couple. Trying to preserve his anonymity, he turns t walk off toward the distant figures of Opbst and Haverman The Guard holds up the camera case he took from Davey and yells at Rice.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ae Gi oa a Bape eve? veer

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey, this your camera case? Rice halts, looking like he’d like to deny it, but thinks better of it, and manages a very uncomfortable nod. GUARD ; Well, come on over here and take it. George turns to Eunice, throwing a smile at Davey on the way.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Why don't you take the boy to our car while I straighten this out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (desperately pointing to the case in the Guard's arms) But that case has the secret plans in it ---

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: (patting Davey on the head) Of course, it does, dear.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But it does --- Before he can say anything more, Eunice takes him by the shoulders and steers him toward a non-descript blue Ford Fairlane parked just down the street. Davey keeps glancin back at the three men, the security Guard, Rice, and Geor MacCready lost in conversation. And behind them, watching him stands Opbst. Eunice clucks at him the entire time as she leads him toward her car.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Now, now, don't fret yourself. George will take care of everything. He's very good at that. She opens the passenger side door to the front and shoos Davey inside before he can argue any further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey slides across} the seat and stares out the driver's side window as Eunite gets in beside him. He watches as the security Guard walks away, apparently satisfied with whatever explanatidn he's received. George continues to talk to Rice, the dider man gesturing animatedly, seeming very angry, the killer listening almost contritely, both men clutching theiy identical camera cases. Davey's eyes widen as the conversation suddenly ceases and the two exchange camera ca

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: him the camera case back.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: He did? ell, he must have had a reason to do it. George always knows what\he's doing. Davey turns to Eunice’ of Rice behind him an unaware that George has broken free is walking toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But you don't understand. There was a Donkey Kong tape in there, only it wasn't a Donkey Kong game, it was --- The driver's door sudderly opens and George slides in, tossing the camera case |to Davey, and starting the car.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Is this what you're so worried about?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (holding| the case almost broken-heartedLy) No, sir, it was ithe other case, the one you gave that man just now. That was the one| that had the secret plans in it. :  77 78

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ford pulls out into/ traffic and disappears down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they drive along, dusk begins to slip into night. George takes his eyes from the road long enough to toss a amused glance at the dispirited boy in the seat beside hi

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure I gave the wrong case back?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (nodding at the case in Davey's hands) Open it and find out. Davey opens the case, hardly daring to believe the tape might actually be there. But there it is at the bottom of the case, black and rectangular with that stupid logo on it. Davey whips the tape out, flashing George a joyous smile.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You got it!

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: (smiling benevolently at him) See. I told you. George is real good at making things come out right.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (to George) But how'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I just gave that man my camera case in its place. He never noticed the difference. Now do you mind telling us what this is all about? After all I've sacrificed my good camera to save your Donkey Kong tape.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But it isn't a Donkey Kong tape. There's an extra micro chip in here that contains the plans to some important American defense project.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Then why would that man have it at the Alamo?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He was going to give it to some Russian spy.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: (breaking in) Really? Did he say what this spy looked like?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Only that he had two fingers missing.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: How exciting! May I see that tape, Davey?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Sure. He holds the tape out to her. She primly removes one of the gloves she always wears and grasps the tape with her thumb, first and second fingers. The other two are Missing. Davey stares at the mutilated hand in numb horror. Eunice frowns at the boy.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Something wrong, Davey? His terror-filled eyes lift to stare at her cold face. He makes a sudden dive over her for the door, but George grabs him and roughly yanks him back down in the seat, hurting him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Sorry.... Eunice takes out a bottle of Chanel Number 5 and methodic sprinkles the "perfume" onto her handkerchief as Davey wa fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: She probably dropped her walkie- talkie.... On the word "walkie-talkie," Davey has a sudden and horri thought. He looks to his own.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Her walkie-talkie...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim is trying to raise Davey on her walkie-talkie. It doesn't work.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Hello, Davey? (pause) Can you hear me? She gets nothing...not even static.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Hello? She listens in her receiver, hears a strange “"beep-beep- beep" continuing faintly, relentlessly, with the precisio ef a clock. She screws up her face at the strange noise, considers the walkie-talkie broken.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Cheap thing. She throws it back in her pack.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We have to tell her! (thinking, sees car clock:
I'll call my dad!

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Don't waste your time. He already thinks you're a nut case. (looks out window, Plucks at Davey's sleeve) Look out...! Flack points out the window. Rice and Opbst are running toward the car. They'll be there in just a few seconds. Davey just drops the phone. He and Flack slip out the broken window on the side opposite the killers' approach.  103 104 105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice and Opbst reach the Cadillac, just as the black van whips out of the garage behind them. Opbst tears open the door, his gun ready, and looks insid He turns back to Rice.

dialogues.speaker: OPBST
dialogues.text: He's gone. The black van pulls up beside them, Haverman behind the w Rice motions him forward.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: We'll search on foot. He can’t have gotten far.

dialogues.speaker: HAVERMAN
dialogues.text: That's what you said last time. They exchange dirty looks, then the black van drives ahea while Rice and Haverman search on foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey and Flack stop beside a public phone booth. Davey w off his backpack, takes a quarter out of it, and drops it the ground, stepping into the booth. Flack crowds in behi him looking at Davey with an almost joyous smile.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: You know, this is starting to get good.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (looking at him like he's crazy as he dials) What?

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Just like Cloak and Dagger.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (listening to the phone ring on the other end) Are you crazy? They're trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (poking him in the ribs to make sure he gets the joke) They can't kill me. Can't even see me!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (outraged) They can kill me.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Not if you're good enough. That's what the game's all about. Right? (pause) Right? Davey just ignores him, speaks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (into the phone, suddenly) Yes, could I speak to Master Sergeant Hal Osborne, please. It's his son calling. cuT To

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal picks up the phone, as in the b.g., several ground cr under his command, service F~410 fighter jets.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hi, Davey. Why aren't you in bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey into the phone desperately, Flack peering over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Dad, you've got to help me. Those spies put a bomb in Kim's walkie- talkie and she doesn't know it --- cuT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal stiffens, cutting Davey off.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Davey, I told you...I don't want you getting into those games...!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Dad, this isn't a game. I need your help ---

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (anguish, guilt) I don't have time for this, Davey. I have a rush job here --- cuT To INT. PHONE BOOTH ~- STREET ~ NIGHT - INTERCUT WITH HAL aT

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (almost in tears now) Dad, please, listen to me. They're going to take the plans out of the country at midnight --- Unseen by either Davey or Flack, the black van turns the corner and cruises down the street behind them. It's obvious Haverman hasn't spotted the boy yet; it's just as obvious he will any second.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Davey, just calm down. You've worked yourself into a state again. I'll be home soon --+ Behind Davey, the van suddenly stops, then creeps forward toward the phone booth. Haverman has spotted Davey.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (the tears coming now) Dad...! I'm not home. Please listen to me for once. I promise i'm telling the trutht I'm down by the river walk. But don't worry about me. You've got to get to Kim before the bomb.... The van picks up a little speed, heading directly toward the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Davey, stay right where you are. I'm coming. Now, listen to me. Find a street sign. Tell me what it says on it ---

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 109
dialogues.text: But before Hal can finish, Haverman suddenly shifts gears and lays rubber, the black van roaring down the street toward the phone booth. The screech of the tires draws Flack's attention. He looks up to see the van tearing directly for them.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Let's go -- ! He and Davey tumble from the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey and Flack just roll out of the van's path as it sma “inte the phone booth, totally demolishing it in an explo of splintering glass and chrome. INT. VAN - NIGHT lil Haverman's miscalculated, a wall's rushing up at him. He tries to turn, but it's too late. He doesn't even have time to scream. EXT. STREET - STORE FRONT ~- NIGHT 1l2 The van plows into a store front directly behind the demo ished phone booth, and comes to a halt, upended on its si cur To

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal snaps the receiver up and down trying to get his son back on the line.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Davey, Davey ~- ? Hal drops the phone, fear in his eyes. His conversation has attracted the attention of fellow workers, who look o curiously as his imagination carries him into agony. He bolts from his desk, confused, but knowing he must leave. He addresses his nearest Coworker on his way out,

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: COWORKER
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I dunno. I gotta go. My son... (leaving, dazed) T dunno.... Hal runs out of the hangar, his face showing that a terri lesson is being learned, possibly too late. CUT BACK To

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flack helps Davey to his feet, both of them staring at th wreck. Haverman's dead body hangs out the front window of the van.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (patting Davey on the shoulder) One down, two to go! (shoving Davey toward the van) Get his gun ---

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Come on! Get with it! You can use a real gun about now.... But Davey is repulsed by the sight of Haverman's body. He turns his attention to a jewelry store window, crammed wi clocks. They all read 11:10. Davey's eyes widen with fear

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We gotta get across the river to the bus stop. We need a bus to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Pick up the gun Davey, or you're gonna lose the game. _ But Davey takes off down the street. The super spy has no choice but to run after him, although he does turn back once or twice, looking wistfully at Haverman's .38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A public bus rolls along the freeway, moving well within the legal speed limit, cars passing it all the time.  116 #02160 88 and 89 Rev. 8/3/83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim sits at the front of the near-empty bus, staring at t clock that ticks away on the dashboard. It reads 11:30, clicking over to 11:31 as she watches. (X)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 116
dialogues.text: The camera pushes in on the backpack, dissolving through material to the walkie-talkie inside and then through tha into the very guts of the machine. It is stuffed with pla tique explosive, a profusion of colored wires, and a digi readout counter that is clicking away like mad, rushing toward the fatal hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey races down the samp stairs he took earlier in the day, leaping them four ak a time. EXT. OUTDOOR CAFE - a 118 At the same cafe wher¢ he stopped for help earlier in the day. Davey skids to bh halt between the deserted tables, and looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Only twentytfive minutes till midnight -- He turns, about to ru drinking filtre coffee only to see Flack sitting at a table calmly looking up at Davey.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: You're going \to have to take these guys out you OW. Before Davey can think $f a reply, he hears the killers coming. He dashes away, ignoring the super spy, racing down the river walk intd the darkness. Flack watches him go. A moment later Rice and into the darkness. No D night and stillness and tO Opbst. ee ee pbst appear, staring down the walk vey, no Jack Flack, nothing but nempty coffee cup. Rice turns

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: Give me the ma¢hine gun. Opbst tosses him the Schmeizer. Rice snags it out of the

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: I'll take this| side. You take the other. Opbst draws his Luger wilth the silencer on it, clears th chamber, and slowly begijns to walk down the path, his ey probing every shadow fof Davey. cuT To

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey hurries across the bridge, freezing midway. From hi point of view, he sees Rice and Opbst stopping, searching the shadows and moving on, then suddenly Rice spots Davey

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: There he is! Davey turns and runs, the killers following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey runs along the river then through an arched tunnel beneath the road that passes overhead, leaving his pursue far behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up his pace and runs headlong along the tree-lin path. He disappears into the shadows of another bridge on the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey trips and sprawls headfirst onto the path, ripping his pants. He sits up, grabbing his knee. He's skinned it badly, blo beginning to well up through the torn skin. Flack suddenly steps out of the shadows, staring back the way Davey just came, listening hard.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: They're coming. (X) (turning to Davey) Now just wait here and take them out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (looking up at him) I don't wanna kill anybody.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Davey, you know the rules. You're (X) . s'posed ta take out the obstacles before you reach the objective.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 92 (X) Rev. 9/1/83 124 FLACK (Cont'd) (offended) Ya can't just go right for the ebjective. That's no fun.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Fun?! We've got twenty-four minutes till the bomb goes off.... Davey is unconvinced. They lock finally:

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: That's why ya gotta take these guys out!

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: C'mon. How many people have I killed for you over the years? (pause) And now you don't wanna play... (pause) This is Cloak and Dagger, Davey. For real! Just what you've always wanted.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But I don't have a gun or a knife or anything....

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (excited) ‘The ‘crossfire gambit’ ..‘ Remember the crossfire gambit..? (nodding down path) Go back down there, hide until the Mexican guy has passed you, then attract Rice. Lead his fire. Under- stand? (adding the final coup) Who's going to save Kim if you don't? eyes; a moment passes. Davey considers, then

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (x) Davey whirls and runs down the path, disappearing into th night. Flack stares after him.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Good luck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opbst pads along silently, his gaze probing every nook an cranny, every shadow along the walk. Davey crouches in the darkness of the tunnel. He stares into the darkness as the spy passes. Nearby, a rat chirps and scurries out from near Davey. Opbst shoots him. Then there is silence again. But Davey now looks around for ether rats that might be surrounding him. He turns and looks along the path. There, glimpsed for a moment in a splash of moonlight is Rice. Davey takes a deep breath, gulps, and suddenly jumps up shouting and waving his hands.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Hey, Ricey! Whatsamatter? Can't ya shoot straight? EXTERIOR, -. FURTHER BACK =NIGHT. .... ve te re en BBL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice's gaze is torn from the path directly ahead of him, toward the boy in the tunnel. All he sees is the kid jump around, mocking him, laughing at him. He whips the Schmei machine gun up and fires, stitching a line of bullets alo the walk behind the boy, slowly catching up to him as Dav breaks into a run, dashing through the tunnel after Opbst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opbst stands beyond the tunnel, looking back the way he just came, listening to the soft sound of the bullets smashing into the dirt along the path. Suddenly Davey appears out of the darkness, almost crashing into him, zigzagging around him at the last moment, and down the path.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ra

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED \ 127
dialogues.text: Opbst whirls, sightihg on the boy with his pistol, drawin a bead on the small x his back, unaware of the bullets t.
stitching along the h, behind him, headed directly toward him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just as he's about to /pull the trigger and shoot the boy down, the machine gun/slugs find him, ripping into his body, jerking him arownd, almost cutting him in half, throwing him backward/and into the grass. The Luger flies out of his hand and skitters across the path. Davey emerges out of the shadows and stares down at Opbst The man doesn't even praten. Jack Flack steps out of the darkness by the tunnel coming to a stop above the dead man's Luger, pointinglat it.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (jubjlantly) Great work, |Davey! Now get the gun. Davey turns to him, still in shock, nodding at the body i the grass.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Don't worry about that now, Davey. You're winning. Just hurry over here and pick up his gun.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (a little in shodk) My dad was right. (turning to Flack) . 1 don't.wanta play anymere. Davey turns, looking at the Luger at Flack's feet, glanci back down the path where he can now hear Rice approaching Back and forth his head gdes, between the gun and the approaching killer, the killer and the gun.

dialogues.speaker: LACK
dialogues.text: (childishLy) {X) Come on! Don't be a spoilsport now! What are yqu, chicken?! Davey suddenly whirls, run without breaking stride an disappearing into the nigh totally surprised. to the gun, scooping it up continuing on down the path, Jack Flack stares after him,

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (calling after him) Don't go down there, dumb head! It's a dead end!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 127 But the boy is gone. Flack glances at his watch. It reads 11:38, twenty-two minutes till the bomb goes off. i FLACK (to himself) Jesus --- With one glance over his shoulder at the sound of Rice's approaching footsteps, the super spy dashes after the boy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey skids to a sudden halt, facing a blank concrete wal twenty feet high. He's reached a dead end. He whirls, looking to his left: nothing there but more high wall. He glances to his right: nothing there but the river. He stares back the way he's just come. He can hear Rice's footsteps pounding toward him out of the darkness. He's trapped with nowhere left to run.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 128
dialogues.text: He stands there, breathing hard, the cold certainty of defeat and imminent death sinking in on him. Farther down the walk, Rice runs into view, stopping as h sees the cornered boy. Smiling, he slowly starts to walk toward him. Davey backs away, raising Opbst's Luger in th dark.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Stay away from me or I'1l shoot.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: (mocking him) Sure you will. Red ink. (X) (raising his machine: gun) Only this one shoots real bullets.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (continuing to back away) I'm warning you, this isn't a water pistol ---

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: (holding up the machine gun) Neither is this. (X) Rice twirls the machine gun with a display of gunhandling virtuosity. It ends up in firing position. oe RICE (Xx) If I wanted, I could turn you into shredded meat-in five seconds with this baby. But you've been a real pain in the ass. So i'm not gonna be that nice. You know what I'm going to do to you, boy? Mesmerized by the evil in the man's tone, Davey can only shake his head as he backs away.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: I'm going to blow both your knee= caps off. It won't kill you, but it'll hurt worse than any dying you can imagine. Then you know what I'm gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly Jack Flack materializes next to Davey, his gaze snapping from Rice to the trozen boy.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Shoot him, Davey, shoot him! (X) Davey just stands there, mesmerized by the evil in Rice's voice.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: I'm gonna shoot you in the stomach. Then when you beg me to finish the job, I won't. I'm just gonna watch and enjoy mysell as you die. Davey bumps to a halt, his back against the wall, no furt to go, no place to run or hide, trapped. He holds the Lug up, pointing it directly at Rice's face. FLACK (x) Shoot! Pull the trigger...!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Stop, please, stop. I don't want to shoot you!

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: Sure, you don't. But I want to shoot you. He lifts the gun and aims at Davey, beginning to squeeze the trigger. The boy stares at him, unable to find the will to fire his own gun.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: -¢shoutimg untils- crt ee Be ee ee tee red in the face) Kill him! Kill him! (mot understanding Davey's hesitation) This guy's a jerk! Just kill him! (X) (getting impatient) Aw, heck! I'll show you what a real hero does. Watch this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey sees Flack suddenly run along the wall, angling toward Rice, whipping off his spy hat with the bullet- proof shield, holding it in Rice's direction.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Get: him to shoot over here! Old (X) Agent X'1ll bounce the bullets right back at him. It'll be great!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FLACK (Cont'd) (trying to egg Rice on) Come on, you turkey! Shoot me! Or can't ya find the trigger?! Ha ha ha!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Don't, Jack! Rice, alarmed at the possibility of an accomplice with Davey, instinctively whips his Schmeizer around, shoots a burst of machine-gun fire at the super spy. The pyrotechnics are wild, as a mixture of brightly glowi tracer bullets and standard ammunition flies through Flack's semitransparent body, throwing him back as each slug enters and passes through his body, tearing through his flesh and clothing, then crashing into the wall behin him. It is a spectacular death, and it horrifies Davey to see his friend murdered.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (standing, screaming) Nott! Davey raises the Luger, fires it at Rice, the bullet slamming into the killer, right between the eyes, propelling him backward, the part of his face which can still be seen now looking stunned, just before the blood gushes. Rice topples into the river, and floats away. Davey runs over to where Jack had just been. He seems to have vanished.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Jack! Jack materializes behind Davey, in perfectly good shape. There is no sign of any physical damage. Just a little dust. The kind you get playing guns. He brushes himself off.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Good work! You won!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (in disbelief) You're not dead?

dialogues.speaker: ELACK
dialogues.text: Never even touched me. (suddenly noticing bullet holes in his hat, looking disgruntled) Hmh. I guess this thing doesn't stop real bullets. Hmm. Davey's eyes snap back to Rice's body, floating down the river.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He could see you. Jack just shrugs. He doesn't seem to know or care.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: I doubt if he had the imagination. Who cares! You're a hero now. Davey looks at Rice's body, bobbing in the river. He showly shakes his head in the negative.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: You killed the bad guy, Davey. You won the game. How does it feel?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: That wasn't fair! You tricked me! You made me kill him! weep agen cee -FLACK. ou < peat henge tebe ne tee A “clear | case of self- defense! Davey whips the lead figure of Jack Flack out of his pocket, is about to throw it ---

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What are you doing? But it is too late. Davey throws it right through Flack, causing it to bounce off the concrete wall and land back near his feet. Davey stomps on it, bending the lead pathetically out of shape. The boy and the super spy remain frozen on the walk. Flac turns to Davey, his face filled with sadness and pain.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Why did you do that? This was our best adventure yet.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (still furious) I don't want to play anymore. Flack, deeply hurt by the boy's action, sits down, weak.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (genuinely puzzled) Why do you kids always do this?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Buh?

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (reminiscing) Your father was the same way. And after all those games of cowboys and Indians.... Davey is puzzled, doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (complaining) ..-It always ends like this. You get tired of...make believe... (looks wistfully to the broken figure) ...then you break your toys. Flack suddenly feels something, looks down as bullet hole begin to materialize for real in his Flack jacket, blood beginning to show,

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: (looking down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! He suddenly coughs and weakens.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (staring) He did hit you...!

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: I'm okay. We better get to the airport.... He begins to move dizzily. Suddenly Davey realizes that the front of Jack's shirt is drenched in blood. Davey stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But you're bleeding. I didn't think anything could hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Maybe you better go to the airport without me...You're the hero now -- you don't need an cid jelly blaster like me....

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Don't say that. You'll be fine. Davey grabs Flack as he falls, gently cradling the man's head in his lap. The super spy looks up at him, trying to smile through the pain.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Never did like that rule. (fading fast) I always have to leave when they stop believing....

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (not wanting to hear) Just hold on Jack. I'll get help.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: {making light of it) No use. They couldn't see me anyway --- (smiling at Davey through the Pain) It was fun though...wasn't it Davey?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No, Jack! It isn't over!

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: You were the best Playmate I ever had. Do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: {in a panic) Don't leave me!

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: I have to, kid. You're growin' up. Flack manages to smile at him, then a coughing jag hits h and he loses the smile, blood flecking the corners of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Pass me a smoke, will you. (X) Davey reaches for the super spy's shirt pocket, but Flack nods at the ground behind him.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK
dialogues.text: Over there. On the ground. Davey rises and turns, searching the ground for the smoke that aren't there. Behind him, Jack Flack begins to fade, his body turning more and more transparent. His dying eyes are on Davey, taking a last glance at his friend. A sweet sad, wistful smile wreathes his lips and an instant later the super spy snaps out of existence, gone into the night air forever. Davey can't find the cigarettes and turns back to tell Flack, only to discover he isn't there any longer. Stunned, Davey stops crying. He looks around wildly. Rice's body is there, the path and the night are there, everything is there except Jack Flack. Davey lifts his head and calls into the night.

dialogues.speaker: . DAVEY
dialogues.text: Jack, where are you? And a voice answers him out of the ether, getting (X) further and further away all the time. (x)

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Jack, Jack, come back. I can't do it on my own! The voice getting farther and farther away.

dialogues.speaker: FLACK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Yes, you can, Davey -- You were always on your own. (X)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Davey keeps looking up at the summer sky overhead, the swirling clouds doppling the slate-grey darkness of a Tex summer night. He nods up at those clouds way up above, wiping the tears away. He looks at his watch. It's 11:42. He hobbles hurriedly down the path, dragging his wounded leg after him, moving as fast as he can for the nearest exit. cur To

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 129
dialogues.text: deor and she opens it hurriedly to find Hal and DioGuardi standing there. Hal looks just as worried as Marilyn.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Uh...you're Kim's mother, right?

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: (worried sick) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (embarrassed by his lack of manners) Uh, I'm Davey's father...uh, I've been meaning to come over and introduce mys ---

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Yes, I've heard a lot about you. Where's Kim? Hal and DioGuardia look to each other, more worried now.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: She's net here?

dialogues.speaker: LT. DIO GUARDIA
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I'm ---

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (interrupting) ‘Oh; ah, this is Cieutenant.... Hal forgets his name.

dialogues.speaker: LT. DIO GUARDIA
dialogues.text: DioGuardia. I'm with the San Antonio Police.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: You'd better look at this.... She picks up Kim's note, hands it to DioGuardia, looks worriedly to Hal, who reads over the Lieutenant's shoulder. The note reads: "Have gone to airport. Bring police. Love, Me."

dialogues.text: (accusingly, to Hal) Is this another one of your son's games?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED

dialogues.text: Davey hobbles as quickly as he can to a stopped bus. The door is open. A disinterested Driver sitting at the wheel as a few passengers await its departure.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: This the bus to the airport?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Davey moves up the steps, reaching for his backpack only realize it isn't there. He looks at the Driver helplessly

dialogues.text: (like a broken machine) Dollar fifty!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (turning his pockets inside out) But I don't have it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (desperately) But you have to. I'1l pay you when we get to the airport --- ee - DRIVER bee . Loe a Los Sorry! Davey turns and climbs off the bus. EXT. BUS STOP - STREET - NIGHT , 129-c Davey alights from the bus, the hiss of the airbrakes mocking him as it departs. cuT To

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several cabbies stand around talking before an all-night donut shop, their cars waiting for fares at the curb. Davey skids to a halt before a pot-bellied older driver.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Mister, take me to the airport, please.

dialogues.speaker: OLD CABBY
dialogues.text: {looking at the disheveled boy doubtfully) You got any money, son? Davey hesitates, not used to lying, but deciding to do so in this case.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, tons.

dialogues.speaker: CABBY
dialogues.text: (reading the lie) . Forget it, kid.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But, mister, I have to get to the airport --- But the man has already turned away, lost in conversation about the San Antonio Spurs with a buddy. Davey hobbles t the next cabby,. an aging, Hippie with a day's growth. .

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Will you take me to the airport, please? I'll find some way to pay you when we get there. The man just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Please, it's a matter of life and death!

dialogues.speaker: HIPPIE
dialogues.text: (fixing him with a doubtful eye) That important, huh? (seeing his wounded leg for the first time) What happened to your leg?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (tearing up and plucking at his shirt- sleeve) Please, mister, I have to get to the airport quick.

dialogues.speaker: HIPPIE
dialogues.text: Maybe {i should get you to a hospital first. That leg doesn't look too good.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I haven't got the time. If I don't get to the airport now, this girl is going to die. Another moment passes, the aging Hippie staring at the ki the kid staring back, neither blinking. Suddenly the cabb walks to his car and throws the back door open.

dialogues.speaker: HIPPIE
dialogues.text: Get in. Davey dives inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hippie slides behind the wheel and starts the car. Davey leans over the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: How long does it take?

dialogues.speaker: HIPPIE
dialogues.text: At this time of night, about ten minutes. te He floors it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab peels out into traffic, burning rubber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim fidgets impatiently while a Clerk behind the counter checks the computer for arrivals and departures. The Cler finally looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Flight 146 to Paraguay is about to board at Gate Fifteen, Concourse B.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Thanks <-- She whirls and runs down the terminal, headed for Concour

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: EXT... SAN ANTONIO EXPRESSWAY. - .NIGHT soe : 135 The cab carrying Davey speeds along, headed toward the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey glances at his watch. It reads 11:47. He leans over the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Can't you go any faster? Please. I only have a few minutes left.

dialogues.speaker: HIPPIE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, boss --- He floors it. The cab leaps ahead, going even faster. cur Ta  137
