dialogues.text: Kim stands before a security Guard at the checkpoint prio to the main boarding terminal where all passengers must pass through the metal detector and have their hand lugga searched and X-rayed before they can board. She's deep into her effort to explain to the man what Davey told her

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (caught midsentence) -- but I'm telling you these two spies are leaving on the twelve o'clock flight to Mexico City --- (X)

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (interrupting) That flight hasn't started boarding yet.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I know. They told me that at the check in counter, but you have to stop them from getting on the plane. You see, they have this Donkey Kong tape ---

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (staring at her incredulously) What?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (beginning to lose patience) A Donkey Kong tape. You know, a game cartridge. Only it has these (%) stolen government plans in it ---

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (interrupting her again) What's this couple look like? George and Eunice MacCready walk right in front of Kim, b she just stares at them blankly, getting really exasperat with the security Guard.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I don't know. Kinda old. One of (x) them only has two fingers. Or maybe it's three. I forget. Look, would- you just stop the plane from boarding before they take off in it?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: eset ofS abla bend ntl Yemenite nie = Seah  137 138 139 140 141

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: I think we'd better talk to the Chief of Airport Security --- The MacCreadys stop against a wall and with a casual glan to make sure no one's watching, George MacCready slips hi -9 mm. Llama automatic into a newspaper and drops both into a trash can. Across the floor, the Guard takes Kim by the arm. He leads her toward a door marked “Airport Security” whil George and Eunice MacCready take their place at the back the line feeding through the metal detector, the camera case swinging casually from George's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab carrying Davey screeches to a halt before the entrance to the international terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey pauses with his hand on the door, looking at the aging Hippie.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I'll see you get your money somehow --~

dialogues.speaker: HIPPIE
dialogues.text: Forget it, kid --- Davey leaps out of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes into the terminal, dragging his bad leg behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey skids to a halt before the check in counter, lookin around wildly for a glimpse of Kim. She's nowhere in sight. He dashes for a public courtesy booth.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: How do I find somebody? A woman leans forward to answer him. cuT To sees Hace  142 143

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim sits in a chair facing the Head of Airport Security, the Guard who brought her into the office standing behind her.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: (caught midsentence) -- and that's all the description (X) you got?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (all patience gone) I told you, we got cut off. (X) (pause) - Look, all you gotta do is check their fingers. Jeesh. She hears the PA system blaring from outside.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Flight 467 to Mexico City is now (%) boarding at Gate Fifteen. Will all passengers ---

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (rising out of chair) That's their flight ---

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: (taking: out - ve . Se “ his report) Now just let me get all this down --- Kim glances up at the wall clock. It reads 11:54, six minutes till the-bomb goes off, six minutes till the flig leaves. She whips her gaze back to the security Chief, almost screaming at him in her frustration.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: But there isn't time --- The Guard behind her forces her gently back into her seat Kim looks at him like she'd like to kill him. The camera dollies in on the walkie-talkie poking out of her backpac the second hand on the overhead wall clock ticking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey stands by a public courtesy phone as the overhead speaker blares an announcement.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Will Kim Gardener please report to the white courtesy phone. Will Kim Gardener please report to --- Davey looks up and down the terminal, waiting for some si of Kim. There is none. His eye catches a computer screen overhead listing all the arriving and departing flights. He has no trouble finding Flight _ to Mexico City. The word "Boarding Now" flashes on beside it. He tears hi eyes away, glancing at his watch. Five minutes left till the bomb goes off. He looks up and down the terminal, desperately searching for some sight of Kim.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (in midst of bureaucratic interview) Did they just call my name?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: (preoccupied with paperwork) I wasn't listening. What was your mother's maiden name? Do you know - What that means?..... toe oe me

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I think they said 'Kim Gardener.' That's me...!

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Just a couple more questions....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MacCreadys have just passed through the checkpoint an are walking toward the entrance to the boarding area as Davey skids to a halt before the guards, the metal detect to one side with a waiting line behind it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Pardon me, have you seen a girl about eight? She's got blonde hair and....

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He keeps glancing around even as he talks, hoping to catc sight of Kim. Suddenly he see the MacCreadys walking with stately steadiness toward their boarding area. Davey suddenly stops talking, pointing at them, and shouting.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Stop them! The MacCreadys turn and stare at the boy as Davey tries t dash around the X-ray machine only to be snagged by one o the guards.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Just a second there, son. Davey frantically struggles to free himself, still pointi at the MacCreadys who watch him with looks of frozen horr on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But they've got the tape ---+

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, son, but you can't pass through here without being searched first. Who you with anyway?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (hopping up and down with frustration) But the tape ---

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (pushing him back) Now you'll just have to go around to the other side of the metal detector like everyone else =--- Davey looks at the long line. By the time he is searched and passes through the machine, the MacCreadys will be lo gone. They know that, too, and turn to go on their way. Davey watches them go, not knowing what to do for a moment. Suddenly he wails at the MacCreadys like some long, lost child.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Mom, Dad, please, don't leave me! The MacCreadys freeze again, glancing back as the Guard turns around to look at them. They hurry on their way, suddenly wishing they were invisible. The Guard turns bac to Davey.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (bewildered) They your folks? Davey stands there, watching the MacCreadys getting furth and further away.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, and they told me to wait in the car. They said they'd be right back. Only I knew they were lying. They're leaving me behind forever! The Guard suddenly turns and calls loudly after the MacCreadys.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Just a minute there, folks. Would you mind comin' back here. The MacCreadys stop, exchanging glances. George turns to the Guard, doing his best to smile.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: But our plane’s boarding ---

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: It'll wait. Let's get this straightened out first. Holding Davey by the hand, he walks him toward the MacCreadys, the couple walking back to meet them. Everybody is now glancing at them curiously. They all sto opposite each other, the Guard nodding down at Davey.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: This your boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) (X) Of course not! Do we look like we'd have children that age? The Guard looks down at Davey, none too pleased.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: You putting me on, boy?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (more innocent than apple pie) No, sir. I don't know why they're doing this, but I can prove they're my folks.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He uw Davey turns an angelic smile on the MacCreadys. He points to the camera bag hanging off of George's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY

He hits the soft ground at the side of the runway as the plane careens across the grass Davey shakes his head to clear it, leaps to his feet, running after the plane which is quickly accelerating int the night.

dialogues.text: Dad, Dad -- ! And the plane continues to gain speed, quickly outdistanc the small running boy, roaring off into the night, swallo up by darkness. Davey keeps running after it anyway. The night is suddenly shattered by a huge explosion, a fireball of incredible brightness and size roaring up out of the blackness. The concussion blows Davey back and off his feet, bending the grass and bushes around him almost their breaking point. He picks himself slowly up off the ground, staring down t runway at a night that has suddenly become brighter than day, an enormous fireball of high-octane aviation fuel climbing into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (in a shattered voice) Dad! Tears stream down his cheeks. (X)

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Dad -- !

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He suddenly stops, staring into the almost blinding incandescence of the fireball. A tall, handsome figure of aman backlit in burning orange, shimmering against the night sky and the rising fumes of the fire is walking toward him slowly out of the conflagration. Davey just stares at the apparition, watching the glowing outline of the figure drawing closer and closer to him, something teasingly, wonderfully familiar about it. And then he recognizes the figure, that jaunty, confident walk, the insolent slouch, that aggressive lowered curve the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (staring in disbelief) Jack? And now the figure is closer, almost recognizable...and i looks just like the super spy, everything about him is th same, the walk, the carriage, even the faint smile Davey can barely make out on the man's face.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Jack! And his father stoops down and grabs him up in his arms, swinging him about, cradling the crying boy's face in his son tant eps sian scene SE ODT SHOU AR », athe, and there what seems Tike sevéra eee s  piharty Her Holds Him Sue r a little bit away from him, using his free hand to wipe Davey's tears away, and brushing aside a few of his own a the same time. He smiles almost wistfully at his son. Davey gets his first real good look at his father; sure enough, it's Hal Osborne, his face smudged with the smoke of the wreck, his hair singed by the fire, discheviled an battered, nothing very romantic about him at all. Davey looks at him hard, real joy and relief flooding his small boy's face. He throws his arms around his father's neck again, holding him as tightly as he can.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Dad! How'd you get out?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Jack Flack always gets out.
